bwwExcerpt: Still, at the end of an often brutal Broadway season that was rightly concerned with harm and heartlessness - in which many shows, including this one, were bedeviled by illness and delays - I liked Gold's showing us that in times of distress and violence people should remember to care for one another. If it has nothing to do with "Macbeth," it has plenty to do with us.
showScoreExcerpt:
"Despite the star power of Daniel Craig and Ruth Negga, the overthought production that opened on Thursday at the Longacre Theater seems unsure of its welcome, as if a classic that has enjoyed nearly 50 Broadway revivals since 1768 might no longer find an audience willing to meet it halfway."

Read more
